column4: Well, I'm not sure that I really understand the difference between unity and gnome and kde and xfce or w/e.  Are they simply different looks, or do they actually act differently or have different functions?

Like, my machine has a decent gpu, so should I be using one desktop environment or another to fully utilize it?  I spent quite a while playing around with gnome and compiz and emerald to get it the way that I liked it.  If I decide to install kde and choose it from the login menu, will it disturb my gnome/compiz settings at all?
KDE is entirely separate from GNOME. Your system settings will remain the same, but they will not look the same at all. KDE does not use compiz normally, it has its own window manager
KDE and Compiz are both very eyecandyable
